channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024021369
item.description:
Report X-2024021369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found to be a damage. Package had no marking, but smelled like paint. As soon as it was discovered, immediately placed in a double lined hazmat bin in a well ventilated area. DescribePack: 4 paint with epoxy, all four leaked. Box came open, dropping 3 of the cans out of package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a double lined hazmat bin in a well ventilated area.

Upon inspection found 1 plastic pail of In The Swim calcium hypochlorite 50-lbs was broken with large crack opening on side spilling dirt content. DescribePack: Plastic pail was broken with large crack opening on side spilling dirt content. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote

UPON INSPECTION, DISCOVERED THAT PLASTIC BOTTLE INSIDE BOX LEAKED. HAZMAT PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: LEAKING LID DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, WET BOX WAS PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND TAKEN TO DAMAGED HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024021376
item.description:
Report X-2024021376

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Approximately, at around 4:30, QA was called to unload area by sort manager. Sort manager then informed QA that he found a hazmat. The hazmat was positioned incorrectly, which caused the hazmat to leak out of the fiberboard box and onto a trailer. DescribePack: The package failure was the loading procedure. The hazmat was found positioned on the wrong side. The fiberboard box was damaged due to the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We were able to remove the hazmat drum while using gloves, load it onto the hazmat cage and scrapped the fiberboard box.

item.title: Report E-2024020123
item.description:
Report E-2024020123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: Tampa
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/3/2024, at 0230 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yoeman Yard, in Tampa, Florida, reported tank car RCRX 2714, load, hydrochloric acid, was leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Daikin America, Inc., was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0203-00008). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, and Josh Dearing, a CSX Manager of Hazardous Materials, were dispatched to the scene. Response personnel found that 1 of 4 liquid line closure flange bolts were less than tool tight. Response personnel properly tightened the liquid line closure flange bolts and stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Scott Missildine, 256-476-8009). Additionally, response personnel verified proper securement of all other closure bolts on the tank car’s service equipment, removed hazardous residue from the exterior of the car, and applied a mild neutralizing agent to the car’s surface prior to releasing the car for transportation.

item.description:
Report X-2024020772

  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Oxidizer & Corrosive hazmat package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Rapicide PA part A 5-liters had a defective lid resulted to leakage. The lid had a small manufactured hole on top that was allowing content to leak. DescribePack: Bottle had a defective lid resulted to leakage. The lid had a small manufactured hole on top that was allowing content to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020823
item.description:
Report X-2024020823

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in a trailer from the unload, when the package handler noticed the smell of chlorine and white powder coming out of the box at 9:30 a.m. The package handler immediately reported the package to QA. QA then moved the package away from the unloaders and put it in a red tote. DescribePack: Package failed at the cap of the container which cracked opened due to not enough interior support for the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package from the unloaders

item.title: Report X-2024020820
item.description:
Report X-2024020820

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived to the station already wet and torn, upon discovery it was placed in a hazmat bag and then hazmat bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All four bottles of StatLab Decal stat arrived with loose caps and each lost about 2.5 ounces of liquid totaling 10 ounces. Upon inspection the caps were loose and even the seal underneath was compromised which allowed liquid to seep out and spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival the wet package was discovered and immediately set aside in a hazmat bag and hazmat bin for further containment. No further release was found
